author: Samantha Gee and Sara Meij
title: Trio trapped in wreckage after fatal crash near Nelson
text:
Trio trapped in wreckage after fatal crash near Nelson SAMANTHA GEE AND SARA MEIJ Last updated 12:03, February 27 2017 Nelson Marlborough Rescue Helicopter 
Several vehicles, including a caravan, were involved in the crash which left one person dead. 
At least one person is dead and three others are trapped in the wreckage after a crash on the Coastal Highway, near Richmond in the Nelson region. 
Police are attending the crash which occurred at 10.48am. A car, a caravan and a truck were involved in the accident. 
It's understood that some passengers have critical injuries. Martin De Ruyter 
Emergency services attend the scene of a serious accident on the coastal highway which left a number of people critically injured 
The accident occurred near the intersection of Maisey Rd and the Coastal Highway. 
At least 12 police cars responded to the accident and two fire trucks. 
The Nelson Marlborough Rescue Helicopter landed on the road. 
Other emergency services are en route. 
Last year, residents who live near the intersection of Maisey Rd, Westdale Rd and the Coastal Highway campaigned for the New Zealand Transport Agency to make the road safer before someone was killed or seriously injured. 
Hazel Margaret Gill died after a three car crash at the intersection in December 2015. 
Resident Mike McGee said at the time her death was the final straw. 
"Something has to happen. It's just too dangerous. 
"Just about everybody who lives out here has a story to tell." 
McGee was rear-ended while trying to turn right into Maisey Rd in May, 2013. 
His van was written off and the driver who hit him was injured, but "it could have been a lot worse", he said. 
The main issue is that there are no right-turning lanes for vehicles entering Westdale and Maisey roads from State Highway 60, meaning drivers have to put on their indicator and wait in the middle of the road for a break in traffic. 
Diversions are in place Gardner Valley and State Highway 60. 
There is another cordon in place at Mapua Drive. 
Motorists are asked to avoid the area if possible or take diversions where directed. 
More to follow.
